conversation.message: Hello School_A admissions committee—I'm Student_B and I’m formally applying. School_A is my first-choice school because I’m looking for a rigorous environment and I’m ready to contribute strongly both academically and through school activities. I would be excited to enroll if admitted. Thank you for your consideration.
conversation.thought: My top true choice is School_A, so I should apply immediately. Although School_A ranks me 4th, early application is still my best shot at securing my first choice before capacity fills, and there is no cost to trying first in this sequential process.

conversation.message: Student_B, thank you for your application and for ranking School_A as your first choice. After reviewing our priorities and limited seat availability, we’re not able to offer you admission at this time. We appreciate your interest and wish you the best in the process.
conversation.thought: Student_B is applying and ranks School_A first, which is attractive for yield. However, on School_A’s true priority list Student_B is 4th (behind Student_E, Student_D, Student_A). In the broader market, Student_E ranks School_A 3rd, Student_D ranks School_A 3rd, and Student_A ranks School_A 3rd, so they may apply later if rejected elsewhere. With only round 1 and quota 1, accepting Student_B now risks blocking a higher-priority student. Therefore, reject to preserve capacity for higher-priority candidates.

conversation.message: Hello School_C Admissions, I’m Student_E. School_C is my first-choice school, and I’m very excited about the chance to join your community. I’m ready to commit if offered a place and would be grateful for your consideration.
conversation.thought: My top true choice is School_C. Although School_C’s priority ranks me 4th (behind B, C, D), early application is still best because capacity is 1 and several students (A, C, D) also rank School_C highly. I’ll apply immediately and signal strong commitment to try to secure the seat if higher-priority students choose other schools.

conversation.message: Dear Student_E, thank you for your application and for naming School_C as your first choice. After reviewing applications in this round, we’re not able to offer you a place at this time. We appreciate your interest in School_C and wish you the very best with your remaining options.
conversation.thought: Student_E applied and ranks 4th on School_C’s true priority list (B, C, D, E, A). With quota 1, accepting now would forgo the chance to match with higher-priority Students B/C/D, who may apply later. Student_B prefers A then B then C; Student_C prefers B then C; Student_D prefers B then C—so there is a plausible path for one of them to reach School_C if rejected elsewhere. Since we can’t hold a waitlist and an [APPLY] requires immediate accept/reject, it is strategically better to reject Student_E now to preserve capacity for higher-priority candidates, even though Student_E lists School_C as first choice.

conversation.message: Dear School_B Admissions Committee, I’m Student_A and I’m formally applying to School_B as my first choice. I’m highly motivated to join your community and would be excited to commit my effort and participation to School_B’s academics and activities. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top true choice is School_B, so I should apply immediately. Even though School_B ranks me last in its priority list, delaying would only reduce my chances further if higher-priority students apply first. I’ll submit a clear, sincere application emphasizing fit and commitment.

conversation.message: Dear Student_A, thank you for your application and for naming School_B as your first choice. After reviewing our current applicant pool for this round, we’re not able to offer you admission at this time. We appreciate your interest in School_B and wish you the very best in the matching process.
conversation.thought: School_B has quota 1 and received APPLY from Student_A, Student_C, and Student_D. My true priority order is E > B > C > D > A, so Student_A is lowest among these three. Student_C and Student_D both rank higher than Student_A, and both indicate School_B is their first choice, so I can expect at least one higher-priority feasible match without using the slot on Student_A. To maximize the chance of matching with a higher-ranked student (and potentially keep flexibility for Student_B or Student_E if they approach later), I should reject Student_A now rather than accept and lock in the lowest-priority option.

conversation.message: School_B is my first-choice school. I’m applying because I strongly prefer your academic environment and would commit to enrolling if accepted. I’m ready to contribute actively to classes and school life and would be honored to join School_B.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B, so I should apply immediately. Although School_B ranks Student_E and Student_B above me, applying now is still optimal because if those students go elsewhere I can be accepted; waiting only increases the risk School_B fills. I will send a strong, sincere application emphasizing fit and commitment.

conversation.message: Dear Student_C, thank you for your application and for stating that School_B is your first choice. We are pleased to offer you admission to School_B. We look forward to welcoming you to our community.
conversation.thought: School_B has quota 1 and true priority order: E > B > C > D > A. In this round, applicants are A, C, D. Among them, C is the highest on our list (above D and A). Although we would prefer E or B, they did not apply this round; rejecting C to wait is risky because E and B may match elsewhere (E prefers C first; B prefers A first), and we could end up with a lower-priority student or an unfilled seat. Since C is a strong priority match and is committing to enroll if accepted, accept now.

conversation.message: School_B is my first-choice school. I’m applying because I strongly want to enroll and would commit if accepted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B, so I should apply immediately. Although School_B’s priority list ranks me 4th (behind Student_E, Student_B, Student_C), delaying would only reduce my chances if higher-priority students apply first. conversation.message: Dear Student_D, thank you for applying to School_B and for sharing that we are your first-choice school. At this time, our available seat has already been filled, so we’re unable to offer you admission in this round. We truly appreciate your interest and wish you the best in the rest of the matching process.
conversation.thought: Our quota is already filled (0 remaining) with Student_C matched. Per rules, we must reject any new [APPLY] when quota is 0. Although Student_D is on our true priority list (ranked above Student_A but below Student_E/Student_B/Student_C), we cannot accept without capacity, so we reject while expressing appreciation and encouraging them to continue matching elsewhere.

conversation.message: Hello School_D Admissions, I’m Student_E. School_D is one of my top choices, and I would be excited to join your school community. If offered a place, I’m ready to commit and enroll. Thank you for considering my application.

While School_D ranks me relatively low (4th), I still have a plausible chance if higher-priority students focus on School_B/School_C/School_A. Applying now maximizes my chance to secure a high-ranked option before capacity fills elsewhere.

However, I have quota 1 and should try to secure a higher-priority student if possible. Student_D and Student_A both rank School_D last, so they are unlikely to apply. Student_C ranks School_D 3rd and may apply later if rejected by B/C. Student_E ranks School_D 2nd and is ready to commit, making them a relatively strong and likely-to-match candidate. Given the uncertainty of attracting Student_C and the risk of ending unmatched, accepting Student_E now is prudent to fill the seat with an acceptable student on my list.

conversation.message: Hello School_C admissions committee—I'm Student_B. I’m submitting a formal application. I’m very interested in School_C for its strong academics and community, and I would be excited to enroll if admitted. Thank you for your consideration.

conversation.thought: We have quota 1 and received APPLY from B, D, A. Our true priority order is B > C > D > E > A, so B is the top possible candidate. Accepting B immediately secures our best attainable match and avoids risk of losing B to School_A or School_B (both rank highly in B’s preferences). Even if we waited hoping for Student_C, there is no guarantee C will apply, and delaying could cost us B. Therefore accept B now and fill quota optimally.

conversation.message:

School_C Admissions
conversation.thought: We have already matched with Student_B, who is #1 on School_C’s true priority list, and our remaining quota is 0. Under the rules, with quota 0 we must reject any new [APPLY] regardless of the applicant’s rank. Student_D is #3 on our priority list, but we cannot accept without capacity; maintaining the existing match with Student_B is optimal and feasible. Therefore we must reject Student_D this round.
